name: Raven
movement: walking speed of 10 feet and flying speed of 50 feet
description: A large, black-feathered bird known for its intelligence and ability to mimic sounds, representing death and magic in various cultures.
memorable: Known for its ability to mimic sounds and intelligence, making it a curious companion.
goals: Scavenging for food, observing its surroundings, and potentially assisting adventurers.
relations: Often seen in the company of spellcasters or druids who might train them as companions or messengers.
environment: Commonly found in wilderness and urban areas, often near carrion or places of significance.
strengths: Exceptional mobility with a flying speed of 50 feet and strong perception skills.
weaknesses: Very low hit points and weak physical capabilities, making it vulnerable in combat.
attacks: Beak attack that deals 1 piercing damage, used primarily for non-lethal interference.
most_powerful_ability: Mimicry allows it to imitate sounds for distraction or communication.
senses: Has keen perception skills with a passive perception of 13.
skills: Skilled in Perception with a modifier of +3, allowing it to notice hidden creatures or objects.
additional_information: Can sense carrion within a 60-foot range by smell.
Can remember and repeat up to 20 words from any language it has heard.
Recognized as a symbol of mystery and foresight in many cultures.
Easy to train as a messenger or companion due to its intelligence.
Often associated with death or omens in mythology.

intelligent bird known for impersonation skills
bird that senses death nearby and imitates voices
agile creature that flies fast and finds food
